III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/25/25, a staff member struck a youth multiple times in the
bathroom after the youth swung water at the staff member with a
wet rag.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/26/2025. Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 6/26/2025. Youth A reported he was
walking towards the bathroom and swinging around his towel and
accidentally got water on Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 then
entered the bathroom and he kicked Staff 1 and punched him in
the arm. Youth A reported Staff 1 punched him back in the arm.
Youth A reported he then punched Staff 1 again in the chest at
which time Staff 1 exited the bathroom. Youth A denied Staff 1
said anything to him. Youth A denied any other youth or staff
being around. Youth A reported the situation was not that serious
and Staff 1 did not hit him that hard and that they were just
playing.
Youth A was again seen face-to-face at the facility on 7/11/2025.
Youth A sat at the table and would not speak. When asked how
he was doing Youth A stated he did not wish to talk today. When
asked if he was declining to speak with licensing he nodded his
head for yes and left the room.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 7/11/2025. Staff 1 reported Youth A had
gone AWOL and there was history of youth attempting to bring
vapes back. Staff 1 reported having suspicion Youth A was
attempting to hide a vape in the bathroom. Staff 1 reported he was
suspicious of this due to Youth A walking in and out of the
bathroom multiple times. Staff 1 reported in the hallway outside of
the bathroom Youth A came out of the bathroom and spit at Staff
1 and hit him with water from his wet towel. Staff 1 reported asking
Youth A what was going on and entered the bathroom while it was
empty to look to see if there was a vape. Staff 1 reported asking
Staff 2 to come down the hallway to keep line of sight into the
bathroom while he looked. Staff 1 reported Youth A said to him
from the hallway next to the bathroom Youth A does not like Staff
2

1 as he is always trying to tell on Youth A. Staff 1 denied punching
Youth A or hitting him in any way. Staff 1 denied being hit or
punched by Youth A. Staff 1 recalled Youth B was nearby in the
hallway at the time of the incident. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was in
the hallway but did not come to the bathroom.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 7/11/2025. Staff 3 denied being on the
same floor during the incident. Staff 3 reported having no
concerns with Staff 1 further reporting Staff 1 is great with youth
and is a mild-mannered person. Staff 3 denied witnessing Staff 1
ever horseplaying or hitting any youth at the facility.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 7/11/2025. Director reported Youth A
approached her on 6/25/2025 and stated he wanted to take back
what he said about Staff 1, denying Staff 1 ever hit or punched
him. Director reported Youth A stated he made the false report
because he does not like Staff 1 but he did not do anything to him
and he was trying to horseplay with Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 7/24/2025. Staff 2
reported being in the hallway at the time of the incident. Staff 2
reported Youth A was walking down the hallway and swinging
around his towel while Staff 1 was standing next to the bathroom
door. Staff 2 reported while swinging the towel water from it got
onto Staff 1. Staff 2 reported being about 3 doors down from the
bathroom, not able to see what was occurring. Staff 2 reported
hearing what sounded like someone getting hit and someone
saying “ow” who Staff 2 believed to be Youth A. Staff 2 reported
hearing Staff 1 say “you just wacked me,” and Youth A responding
with “it was a mistake.” Staff 2 denied viewing any marks on Youth
A or Youth A reporting injury. Staff 2 reported Youth A denied any
other youth or staff being on the floor at the time of the incident.
Staff 2 reported Youth A approached him in the hallway after and
told him Staff 1 hit him in the bathroom. Staff 2 reported following
Youth A downstairs to help him file a grievance.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face alongside MDHHS
Specialist on 7/24/2025. Youth B reported being in the hallway
outside the bathroom door when Staff 1 charged at Youth A
swinging at him saying “I don’t care about this job anyway.” Youth
B reported Youth A was at the bathroom sink when Staff 1
punched Youth A in the arm and the chest. Youth B reported
Youth A said he would tell on Staff 1 and get him in trouble. Youth
B inquired if Staff 1 was getting fired. Youth B denied seeing
Youth A hit Staff 1. Youth B was not aware if Youth A was hurt or
had any marks.
3

Video:
• No video footage was available for this incident. Video
footage was requested onsite on 6/26/2025 and via email
on 6/27/2025. It was stated on 8/4/2025 by Director that
video footage of the hallway would no longer be available
due to length of time since the incident.
Documentation Review:
• Grievance dated 6/24/25 authored by Youth A stating he
walked past Staff 1 with his wet towel which got Staff 1 wet
at which time Staff 1 followed Youth A into the bathroom
and hit him three times. Grievance form further states in a
note dated 6/25/25 authored by Director Youth A asked to
“remove” the grievance stating he wanted to get Staff 1 in
trouble.
• Human Resources File for Staff 1 contains 3 disciplinary
notes regarding unrelated matters. File contains 16 hours
of training including training regarding behavioral
management and appropriateness.
• Prohibited Interventions Policy states use of physical
discipline and verbal abuse are strictly prohibited.
Analysis There are no violations established regarding this allegation.
There is not sufficient evidence or consistent interviews to support
Staff 1 hit Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
